about.description:
Collect Faction Badges as you engage with the Taiko universe. These limited-edition NFTs are not just collectibles—they're a testament to your dedication and milestones achieved on your journey.

Be swift, as these badges disappear once their trail window closes.
about.title: How to earn Badges?

gallery.description: A groundbreaking cast of characters emerges to enrich our community and deepen the immersive experience. Meet eight distinct factions, each with its own unique character and flair.

landing.description: To earn Taiko Faction Badges, participants must complete specific weekly challenges outlined in the Trailblazers: Call of Taiko campaign.
landing.title: Start earning factions through weekly trails

items.question: How long does a season last?

items.answer: To enhance your experience and add excitement, we have chosen not to disclose the daily XP limits for each activity. We encourage you to participate in the activities and discover the XP limits on your own.
items.question: What are the point limits?

items.answer: Our leaderboard is based on percentiles which change based on participants.
items.question: What are level quotas?

items.answer: The daily cap resets at 00:00 UTC every day.
items.question: When does the daily cap reset?

items.answer: The daily reset is calculated based on a fixed reset time at 00:00 UTC each day, not from the time you hit the cap.
items.question: How is the daily reset calculated? Is it 24 hours from hitting the cap?

items.answer: Points can be earned through interactions with designated decentralized applications (Dapps). The list of eligible Dapps will be provided in the campaign guidelines.
items.question: What Dapps will I get points for?

items.answer: Yes, L2 bridging activities are included in the point calculation. Ensure you follow the specific instructions provided.
items.question: Do we count L2 bridging, such as from Linea to Taiko, for points?

items.answer: Transaction Value points can be earned for transactions involving USDC, WETH, TAIKO, and USDT.
items.question: What tokens do I get Transaction Value points for?

items.answer:
See Mirror article (https://taiko.mirror.xyz/589CthdX0Qw-hRBeZarEQpjck-v4lJ-gtKz3SZvovt8), we will consider the following activities to help you collect XPs:

- Bridging (ETH)
- Bridging (ERC20)
- Transaction Volume
- Transaction Count (any kind of transaction counts)
- Block Proposals.

This means that providing liquidity will not give you any XPs.
items.question: If I provide liquidity, how will my points be calculated? (daily, just once?)

items.answer: Yes, L2 bridging activities are included in the point calculation. Ensure you follow the specific instructions provided.
items.question: Do we count L2 bridging, such as from Linea to Taiko, for points?

items.answer: Give it a shot—it only costs a few cents to check and see for yourself! :)
items.question: Does WETH/ETH unwrap give points?

items.answer: There could be a delay in syncing points from Galaxe to Trailblazers. Ensure you have linked your accounts correctly and wait for the synchronization process to complete.
items.question: Why are my Galaxe points not showing on Trailblazers?

items.answer: Whitelisting criteria are based on specific activities or qualifications. Ensure you have met all the requirements and participated in the necessary events.
items.question: Why am I not whitelisted to mint a badge?

items.answer: Each faction badge gives a 1.1x booster multiplier. Snaefel NFT holders get a 1.1x points boost, and Taikoons holders get a 2x points boost. If you sell your Faction badge(s) before the end of the season, you will lose the accumulated multiplied Experience Points by the number of Faction badges sold or moved from your wallet. For example, if you’ve collected 8 badges, you have a 2.14x multiplier, but if you sell one, you will have a 1.95x XP multiplier. These multipliers will last for the entire Trailblazer program duration.
items.question: How do the Faction badge multipliers work?

items.answer: No, multipliers are not active yet, but they will be implemented in the future, and your points will be multiplied according to the NFTs you hold.
items.question: Are the multipliers active?

items.answer:
Taikoons - https://www.okx.com/web3/marketplace/nft/collection/taiko/taikoon

Faction Badges - https://www.okx.com/ua/web3/marketplace/nft/collection/taiko/trailblazers-badges

Snaefell are SBTs, meaning you can neither buy nor sell them.
items.question: Where can I buy NFTs which give multipliers?

overview.p1: In Season 1 participants collected 8 unique Faction Badges (Ravers, Robots, Bouncers, Masters, Monk, Androids, Drummers, and Shinto). It turns out all those Badges belonged to the same “Team”; the Devs.
overview.p2: In this season we will be introducing 2 new Teams; the Whales and the Minnows. The introduction of all three Teams will play a thematic role throughout the Season. Each  Team will have a corresponding Faction edition, meaning there will be a Dev Raver, a Minnow Raver, and Whale Raver, etc. for all Factions.
overview.p3: With this change also comes a revised multiplier system where each Faction Badge Team will provide a multiplier to specific point categories (Transaction/Transaction Value)

recruit.p1: A core mechanic in Season 2 will be the ability for participants to Recruit new Season 2 badges by sending their Season 1 Devs out to Influence them. The basic concept is that participants will be able to stake a Season 1 Badge they own, and it will give them a 50/50 chance of Recruiting a Whale or Minnow of the same Faction.
recruit.p2: Participants will also have the ability to increase their chances of getting the Team they want, through a mechanism called Influencing.

devs.description: The Devs are original builders from Season 1 with an overall points multiplier and bonus. To balance things out we have lowered the global multiplier to 1.4x max.
devs.title: The Devs

teams.forumla: The new formula for all Faction Team bonuses will be 0.05 * n where n is the number of Badges the participant owns       when performing any action.

minnows.description: The Minnows are small but plenty, what they lack in funds they make up for with activity. So they will get a multiplier on all Transaction points they earn.
minnows.title: The Minnows

teams.note: Note: Participants are not required to pick a single Team to collect Badges for, but rather they are encouraged to collect the ones that suit their style and needs the best. The multipliers do stack, so for the max multiplier, a participant would need to collect them all.
teams.title: Meet the Teams

whales.description: The Whales are the big bagged ones, they make splashes in DeFi. So they will get a multiplier on all Transaction Value points they earn.
whales.title: The Whales

liquidity_royale.description: To go alongside the rewards offered in the Liquidity Royale program, participants who are not in the top 100, but who still meet minimum liquidity requirements will earn Free Recruits on a weekly basis.
liquidity_royale.title: Liquidity Royale Perk

taikoon.description: Taikoon holders can get excited for the first additional perk coming their way. Participants who were holding a Taikoon during the Season 1 final snapshot will be eligible to receive a Free Recruit from the Minnow Team or the Whale Team.
taikoon.title: Taikoon Perk

begin.title: Season 1 badges are evolving - Here’s how to get your season 2 badge
begin.description: Recruit new Season 2 members to your cause by sending your Season 1 Devs out to find them. Stake one Season 1 badge per cycle, and after 24 hours, receive a new Season 2 badge of the same Faction but from a random Team (Minnow or Whale). Boost your chances of getting your preferred Team by giving your Dev orders through on-chain transactions. This feature is called Influencing.
begin.note: These transactions won’t add any TB points but will enhance your customization options.

entries.question: What is Recruiting?
entries.answer: The Devs are out in full force looking for new recruits to join their Faction. The Recruit tab is where you can send any Devs you control out to find new members to join your cause. Your Dev will always find one new member that belongs to one of two Teams: the Minnows, or the Whales, and will always be the same Faction of the Dev that Recruited them. It takes 24 hours for your Dev to return with a new member. Once you have sent your Dev out it will be staked for the rest of the Season.

entries.question: What does Influence do?
entries.answer:
As your Dev is out looking for Recruits you can give them orders to target a specific Team to join your cause. Every time you give your Dev the order to Influence a particular Team, it will increase your chances of your Dev returning with a member of that Team by XXX%. Every time you give your Dev orders to Influence a particular Team you will see the number increase above that Team on the Recruit Influence page.
If you change your mind about which Team you want to Influence you can select the other Team, and it will reset the Influence counter to 1 for your new target. You can give Influence orders to your Dev once every 1 hour.

entries.question: What are the different Teams and what do they do?
entries.answer:
The Devs (S1 Badges) are the OGs, the ones that build and make things possible. For every unique Dev you control you will receive +0.05x to your Global xp multiplier as well as your Proposer xp.

The Whales are the big bagged ones, they make splashes in DeFi. For every unique Whale you control you will receive +0.05x to your Transaction Value xp multiplier.

The Minnows are small but plenty, what they lack in funds they make up for with activity. For every unique Minnow you control you will receive +0.05x to your Transaction xp multiplier.

entries.question: What can my Dev do while it is staked?
entries.answer: While your Dev is staked you will not be able to take advantage of all of their skills, so you will lose all the multipliers that it would normally give you.

entries.question: What is the Faction Battle Arena?
entries.answer: The Faction Battle Arena is where you can send the characters under your control to battle it out for fame, glory, and of course prizes. For more details on the FBA visit:

entries.question: How many Faction Badges are there to collect?
entries.answer: There are a total of 24 Trailblazer Faction Badges. There are 3 Teams: Devs, Minnows and Whales, and those Teams are split into 8 Factions: Ravers, Robots, Bouncers, Masters, Monk, Androids, Drummers, and Shinto.

entries.question: How often can I recruit new members?
entries.answer: Recruitments happen in cycles. At the beginning of each cycle it will be announced which Factions are able to be obtained during the limited Recruitment period. During each cycle, every user will only be able to Recruit one member from the available Faction(s) PLUS 1 Free Recruitment that they are qualified to make.

entries.question: What are Free Recruitment?
entries.answer: Sometimes you don’t even have to send a Dev out to do your dirty work and the Recruits come looking for you. This normally happens when you are making a big name for yourself by participating in other events, like the Faction Battle Arena or Liquidity Royale. During a Free Recruitment you will also be able to Influence the Team you get, but you do not have to Stake a Dev to do so.
